title: Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Curtis, a 16-year-old Highland steer, died at Allandale Farm in Jamaica Plain, less than a year after his brother Willard.
Curtis and Willard, originally from Bridgewater, Vermont, were beloved figures at the 130-acre Allandale Farm since 2008.
Condolences from the community highlight the positive impact Curtis and Willard had, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox explore trading reliever Jordan Hicks for an infielder; Hicks struggled with an 8.20 ERA in 2025.
Starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval were also discussed in trade talks as spring training approaches.
Red Sox seek to bolster infield with targets like Nico Hoerner, Matt Shaw, and Eugenio Suarez.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: K’Lavon Chaisson, Patriots linebacker, aims to re-sign with New England after a breakout season in free agency starting March 11.
Chaisson excelled with 7.5 sacks, 18 QB hits, and 10 tackles for loss, contributing significantly to Patriots' defense.
Praises coordinators for team's success; Patriots prepare for Super Bowl with interim DC Zak Kuhr after beating prostate cancer.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after battling prostate cancer for four months.
Williams, 51, will travel with the Patriots to Santa Clara for Super Bowl LX, his first trip post-diagnosis.
Williams underwent five chemotherapy sessions at Mass General Hospital; cancer had spread throughout his body before treatment.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council unanimously endorses Plant Based Treaty, becoming Massachusetts's first city to support the global initiative.
The endorsement aligns with Cambridge's climate goals, aiming to reduce emissions and improve public health through plant-based diets.
The City will work to incorporate plant-based options in events and collaborate with other cities to expand treaty support.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, Emmy-winning actress, died at age 71 following a brief illness, known for roles in 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone'.
'A Mighty Wind', featuring O'Hara's notable performance, is available to stream with ads on YouTube.
'Schitt's Creek' showcases O'Hara's portrayal of Moira Rose and is streaming on Hulu and Prime Video.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismisses significance of Super Bowl LX white uniforms despite team's past success in them.
Patriots are 5-0 in white uniforms this season, contrasting Seahawks' 6-0 record in navy blue.
Teams wearing white in Super Bowl hold a 37-22 all-time record, with Patriots winning four of last five in white.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: Cape Cod and the Islands will experience 3-6 inches of snow, with up to 6 inches possible in Nantucket.
Boston and eastern Essex County could see up to 1 inch of snow; areas west of I-495 likely unaffected.
Strong winds up to 55 mph may cause minor to moderate coastal flooding along Eastern Massachusetts on Sunday and Monday.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major trades before Feb. 5 deadline, focusing on smaller roster improvements.
Boston faces salary cap challenges, making it difficult to acquire high-profile players like Giannis or Jackson.
Anfernee Simons is a possible trade asset; Celtics may pursue Ivica Zubac to strengthen frontcourt.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five Boston restaurants obtained all-alcohol licenses under new legislation allowing upgrades from beer-and-wine licenses.
The approved restaurants are 89 Charles, Bebop, Carmelina’s, New England Wicked Craft Company, and Serafina.
The upgrade provision was part of the 2026 Massachusetts State Budget introduced by Rep. Aaron Michlewitz.
